alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 2:16PM CDT until May 09 at 1:18AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri and Kansas... Elk River near Tiff City affecting McDonald County. Shoal Creek near Joplin affecting Newton and Jasper Counties. Spring River near Waco affecting Jasper County. Spring River at Carthage affecting Jasper County. Spring River above Baxter Springs affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring River above Baxter Springs. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Flood waters are one foot in depth across the Baxter Springs High School Track and Field Area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued prior to Saturday afternoon at 230 PM CDT.
